channel.title: Compile help!

item.title: Compile help!
item.dc:creator: @Sonis Sonis
item.description:
@Sonis wrote:

[quote=“coalman58, post:4, topic:265955”][quote author=Sonis link=topic=351149.msg2696272#msg2696272 date=1236297001]

you need to change all the back-slashes to double backslashes…

Open note pad and press (alt)+h and Replace all : [quote][/quote] with [quote]\[/quote]
then to make sure there are no mess ups, replace all [quote]\\[/quote] with [quote]\[/quote]

Save then compile, that should fix most of the errors…

In java you can’t use back-slashes, as they are to escape allowed characterizing formats.
They are what allows you to use double quote(") and back-quotes(`) in java Strings.
[/quote]I did that and I got this

[code]ge(“C:.coalscape_store_32\Sprites\CHATBACK 0.png”);

   ^

Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:215: illegal escape character
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getIma
ge(“C:.coalscape_store_32\Sprites\CHATBACK 0.png”);

                       ^

Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:215: illegal escape character
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getIma
ge(“C:.coalscape_store_32\Sprites\CHATBACK 0.png”);

                               ^

                               ^

75 errors
Compiling Finished.
Press any key to continue . . .[/code][/quote]

Try it again.
You need to replace all the back-slashes with two back-slashes.
To make sure you didn’t turn any of the already double back-slashes into four, replace all four slases to two slashes like I said.

Maybe you didn’t save then compile? did you compile then save or maybe you ascedentally clicked don’t save when you tried to close notepad?

Read full topic

item.title: Compile help!
item.dc:creator: @coalman58 coalman58
item.description:
@coalman58 wrote:

[quote=“Sonis, post:2, topic:265955”][/quote]

you need to change all the back-slashes to double backslashes…

Open note pad and press (alt)+h and Replace all :

</blockquote> with
\

then to make sure there are no mess ups, replace all
\\
with
\

Save then compile, that should fix most of the errors…

In java you can’t use back-slashes, as they are to escape allowed characterizing formats.
They are what allows you to use double quote(") and back-quotes(`) in java Strings.
[/quote]I did that and I got this

[code]ge(“C:.coalscape_store_32\Sprites\CHATBACK 0.png”);

Compiling Finished.
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Help would be nice please![/quote]

you need to change all the back-slashes to double backslashes…

Open note pad and press (alt)+h and Replace all :

</blockquote> with
\

then to make sure there are no mess ups, replace all
\\
with
\

Save then compile, that should fix most of the errors…

In java you can’t use back-slashes, as they are to escape allowed characterizing formats.
They are what allows you to use double quote(") and back-quotes(`) in java Strings.

Read full topic
